title: Honor View 10 can it replace my Samsung Galaxy Note8?

thread.text:
Like the title of the post says, can the Honor View 10 replace my Note8.
Don't get me wrong I love my Note8 but i did not enjoy the price of it, just short of a €1000.00. I have had Samsung Galaxy note's since Note3 and while always expensive I considered them good value for money for what the can do.,But not anymore in my opinion.
I have an Honor View 10 arriving today and I paid less the half the price I paid for my Note8. I bought it because I broke my Note4 playing ingress. The reason I used a Note4 for Ingress was to protect my Note8 from accidents. Didn't want to risk my €1000.00 phone dashing around playing Ingress. So a broke Note4 had me looking for a replacement Ingress phone, so Honor View 10 purchased and is here today😁
Now I am thinking if this phone is good I may just sell my Note8 while it's still worth a half decent amount and just use my Honor for all mobile duties. Without worrying about how much it will cost if I damage it.
So I will report back in a few days and give you my impression of the Honor View 10 against he Note8.

I am looking for to hearing your opinion. 
I sold my Note 8 and got the Pixel 2 XL and I don't regret it at all. I picked up the Mate 10 Pro last week and now I'm trying to decide if I should keep it or the Pixel. Don't get me wrong I like my Pixel but I miss having an IR blaster on phone. Especially when the kids lose the remote control. And the battery on the the Mate 10 is excellent. It easily outperforms the Pixel.

The view 10 is excellent, and pretty close to the note 8 except that it doesn't have a stylus, curved display, questionable updates, warranty support and security. And the note 8 camera is generally better though not twice as good. If those things aren't important then the view 10 is quite an excellent choice for those looking to save money,and not really far behind the note 8. In some things, it probably does better than the note 8 especially in the performance category.

title: Band Support

thread.text: Does anyone know what bands/frequencies the US version is going to support. I'm not having the most luck finding anything current.

replies.text:
GSM:
850, 900, 1800, 1900 MHz
UMTS:
850, 1700/2100, 1900, 2100 MHz
LTE (FDD):
Bands 2, 4, 5, 7, 12, 17
LTE (TDD):
Bands 38, 40, 41
Data:
LTE-A, HSPA, HSUPA
Check with your carriers.

title: Honor v10 review after 2 days usage

thread.text:
1) Back button to close the app..
If we hit the back button to close the app, for ex whatsapp. It only minimizes, and do not close the app instead it still runs.
This is problamtic as the app is still running, which drainse the battery, and if we had open several apps, all those continues to run even thou if we hit back button.
2) Navigation keys is sick which is not given on the body
3) Camera Depth effect is ineffective. I mean user cannot take a depth effect.
4) Motion gesture like taking screenshot opening apps is painful as we need to tap with Knuckle, and most of the time doesnt work at all. One plus 5t is simple as we just need to draw over the glass instead of tapping with knucles.
5) User Interface (UI) is not simple.
6) Honor is poor in sending updates,
great notes, thanks for sharing them

Lmao, this is a waste. UI is not simple? Well duh, it's EMUI, not stock. If you want simple, don't buy anything with a skinned version of Android. Back button doesn't close the app? Again, duh. Apps are kept in memory, if you want them closed, you have to hit the recents button and swipe them away. It's been like this for a long time in Android. This almost seems like a bash against Huawei/Honor or someone that has never used an Android.

replies.text: Yah I was like "what?" When I read it too. Seems like he's new to Android

thread.text: It sounds like you are not enjoying your V10 - I'm sorry about that! Are you thinking about returning your phone and getting another phone; perhaps from a different manufacturer?
Navigation keys is sick and not given on the body?? What??

1- Pressing back button is just to go back. Any app will continue to run in the background until you remove from recents. Even then, depending on the app it will still "run" in order to receive notifications
2-FP scanner is fast. You can use the navigation button for back/home/recents if you choose, or the standard on screen nav-bar. We gave the user a choice
3- We offer the infamous variable aperture mode, portrait mode for front and rear camera.. All aided by the f/1.8 and AI to have a smarter algorithm to differentiate foreground subjects from the background.
4- You can capture a screenshot easily with a double knock of your knucle or the traditional way of holding power and Volume (-). 
5- EMUI 8 has come a long way from previous versions. Simplifying the UI and giving the user a choice of features to turn on. App tray, google now panel are available to use. Want a more clean look, there are theme options from the play store and launchers 
6- The Honor 7x is on February security patch and so is the Honor View 10. Honor View 10 already comes with Oreo and 7x will be receiving the Oreo update starting April 2018. Many devices dont even have Feb. security patch. so...

replies.text: Did they add double tap to sleep on Emui 8? It's a must have feature.

thread.text: Should be able to fix this with the app power/battery management settings in EMUI, right? Oreo has very granular settings on power management - I'm trying to remember exactly how it worked before with EMUI 5.0. Should be a "power intensive" toggle that can set the app to close when a lock screen occurs.

title: Remvoving the plastic cover on top of screen

thread.text:
I was wondering if it is easy (& how) to remove that plastic layer on top of the main screen (placed on phone from factory) without causing any scratches or hurt to the main screen during the process.
Thanks
Is there a screen protector on it?

replies.text: Yes, from the factory there's a built in protector.

thread.text:
Mmmm I'd be hesitant to try that. Shame to wreck the screen...
Why do you want to take it off?

replies.text: I don't like it. I love to use my phone naked and enjoy it till it dies or a better model shows up. I think it can be removed because I've seen lots of reviews on youtube in which the phone appeared without it by looking closely to the borders (i.e. the reviewers ripped that plastic off) and in some other videos, it was there as is.

thread.text: Well, peel off one corner gently and if it goes OK, take it all off...

I know the OnePlus 5T has a similar kind of plastic screen protector on it that comes straight from the factory, so to speak. You *should* be able to take it off, provided that you go slowly and are careful. You should be fine!
It will come off and won't damage the screen. My OP5 had one and I took it off because I thought it looked ugly and I had their faux carbon fiber case to protect the screen anyway.

replies.text: Oh wow, it also came on the OP 5? I do like how OnePlus gives you accessories right out of the box.

thread.text: According to GSM Arena review this phone like many other Honor and Huawei phones doesn't have an oleophobic coating underneath the protector. Why does Huawei keep doing this??

title: Where can you buy the View 10?

thread.text: Is it available yet to purchase? Where can I buy it, and for how much?

replies.text: Amazon - Best Buy - B&H. Just a few where I go to buy unlock devices.
You should also be able to buy it directly from honor. Just depends on who gives you the best deal.
Usa release date is January 8th. Price is rumored to be $600

thread.text: https://www.androidcentral.com/honor-view-10
In Canada, it's available for pre-order from the Honor website.

replies.text: Nice! How much is it for Canada?
Hmm, looks like I was still on the UK website earlier; yet it said it was the "Honor Worldwide" website. Strange...
That sucks. I was hoping that it was available in Canada for you to check it out
Me too! It looks like a fantastic phone!
Ugh... Too many good phone choices out there. I do really like this phone but I also like the mate 10 pro.
Yes, they are WAY too many good phones out there this year... So hard to choose which one to get next.

thread.text: Ebay currently has the best prices. Amazon is absurd at like 770 for it.

Honor's global webpage seems to be selling the View 10 but it's still listed in Euros. Their US website didn't seem to have it listed; but perhaps I missed it while scrolling through. It is a gorgeous phone, to be sure.

replies.text: You didn't miss it, its not there they only show the 7x and below. The UK store shows the view 10 the US page only shows the developer community thing and a place to get notified when its available. I got mine off ebay.
Hmm, weird that they don't sell it through their US store at the moment. Perhaps it has to do with Huawei not being able to make contract deals with US carriers... Blah.

It will be sold as unlocked. I called to see if any phone rep can give me the date. They mention early February . 
The U.S store listed the phone but out of stock.
That's awesome! February is next week! Cool beans!

I bought the unlocked international version and it supports like 4 or 5 of att LTE bands. After some help from their device team they got the network to recognize it and I've got full LTE service. It however doesn't support but 2g or at least that's all I got when I was on T-Mobile network. Which sort of makes sense. I wouldn't hold my breath about a release because I talked to a rep when they lainched it and she said it could be more than six months before it's released and basically they just don't know especially with the US government so opposed to them working with US carriers and possible espionage
So glad your View 10 is up and running! How are you enjoying it so far? Yeah, I imagine it'll be a while before we see it in the States...
Yeah. It going be awhile since I called them again. She said ETA April. Hmmmmm.

title: So - who's going to pick up a V10?

thread.text: Curious - who out there is going to pick up an Honor V10!? Looks like a pretty sweet phone. Thoughts on it, what do you like/not like?

replies.text:
For me, it is the price. The unlocked Note 8 was $500 for previous note 7 owners, with trade in of even a 5 year old phone. So if Huawei can offer a promotion significantly below that price then I would consider it. At the rumored $600... I will pass. 
Obviously my situation is unique but I do find sales on different phones all the time. I will evaluate based on what I can get the phone for

thread.text:
I am. My alternative was Mate 10, but I'm happy they're giving this.
Pro---
Price
3,700mhz battery
Unlock 
Front finger scanner
Slim body design
Con
Wish it's 4000mhz battery

replies.text: It's definitely a good alternative to the mate 10 especially since Huawei isn't releasing the mate 10 in the usa (they are only releasing the mate 10 pro)

thread.text: I just ordered an LG G5, and comparing the specs, it seems as if the G5 has just a bit more - removable battery, USB 3 (and, thanks to Lineage, updatable to 8) - and a lot cheaper.

replies.text: Well the g5 is also an older device. And it's lg. So of course it will be a lot cheaper.
Don't forget massive bootloop. I spent more time talking to rep than enjoy it.
Did it get fixed though? My g4 bootloped and lg usa said though luck since I had the h815.
Nope. I sold the device after it came back from repair.
I certainly don't blame you. I would not want to hang onto a phone like that even after it's fixed

thread.text: From what I've seen about it spec-wise and based on overall hardware appearance, it looks like a gorgeous and smooth device.

replies.text: It definitely looks really sleek and has great specs. I hope that the back is as nice or nicer than the honor 8 one
Yeah! The Honor 8's black is one sweet shade.

thread.text:
I did I purchased it the day after it was released. I love it coming from the OP5 the camera is better and I actually like EMUI after being a fan of stock android the last three phones (Moto X Pure, OP3T, OP5)
Battery life is good so far and performance is great. I miss the alert slider and double tap of the power button to open the camera and the dev community of the OP but otherwise I'm an honor fan. I would love to be able to try out a mate 10 because of the larger battery and the AR abilities though.

replies.text: So glad you are liking your V10! How does it feel in the hand?  And yes, EMUI is great! I really love it on my Honor 8. Super customizable and very fluid. I will miss the user experience when I upgrade (eventually).

Yep it is different than the relatively stock OOS but I like it. Much better than touchwiz on the Note 8 I had for a little bit and I LOVE having a fingerprint scanner on the front even though the v30 and 5t have excellent placement on the back, the front is still my preferred placement.
I like it, I have large hands so using it one handed isn't an issue for me and being able to have a button to automatically pull down the notifications helps. It definitely feels weightier than my OP5 but I like that about phones. Its doesn't feel like the brick the Note 8 was though or like a demo phone like the v30

You're right - a little bit of weight adds a nice feel to a phone. It doesn't feel like you're holding something super fragile. I've never tried a fingerprint sensor on the front of a phone, but I imagine that it would certainly make things easier when checking notifications at a glance; when your phone is on a table or countertop. That button to pull down notifications is great! Glad you are enjoying your phone!

title: Notification Numbers rather than notification dots

thread.text:
I was wondering if it's possible to change notification dots to notification numbers in Honor V10 (which comes with EMUI 8) for apps like FaceBook, Pages Manager, whatsapp...etc?
P.S. sorry that I created this question in a different section by mistake.

Hi there! My Honor 8 is running EMUI 5.0, so I unfortunately do not know a lot about the current new brand of EMUI. If there are no options to enable the numbers instead of notification dots on your display/theme settings, perhaps download a launcher that has those numbered badges. Honor's customer service is also an idea - perhaps contact them and see what they say?
Let us know what happens!
You can. Its in options under notification methods its either icons or numbers.

title: Change honor v10 to english

thread.text: I'm looking to change my v10 to English including voice assistant.

Welcome to the forums! You should find this setting by going to Settings --> Advanced Settings --> Language and Input.
Once you tap Settings, Advanced Settings is the third-last option on the screen. Language and Input is the second item on the next screen.

title: Honor V10 Battery Life

thread.text: Anyone catch the battery life details on the Honor V10?? What's the size and what can we expect?
Battery size is 3,750 mAh with a 1080P screen.

replies.text: My goodness, what an impressive battery size!
Indeed... the other Android manufacturers ought to follow their lead!
Absolutely!
I hope so too. Most have been stuck around 3000-3500mah. I am glad that honor was able to push the envelope a little bit here
Honor seems to always do unique things with their phones - hopefully this helps them stand out a bit. They are underrated and it's unfortunate.
Given that they are giving a good push right now in the united states, let's hope that that effort pays off. But they do need to work on the update situation too before that happens, imo.
Agreed. Hopefully they get the updates issue together; because Honor has a ton of great potential.
I really hope so. They really improved on their software from emui 4 to 5,and while not perfect, performs well enough. So they really need to improve on updates
That's a good size. Hope it gets stand out battery life. My moto z play has a smaller battery and can do 15-18 hr SOT. It also has 1080p

thread.text: Yes, keep up on the updates. I agree 110%

title: Honor View 10 Camera - best yet?

thread.text: Is the camera on the V10 the best Honor has ever produced? Obviously camera quality super important to me, but haven't dug too deep into the specs yet. Is it solid??
Does it have optical image stabilization (OIS)?
Nope
Best honor phone, probably, but also probably the most costly so that makes sense. It probably isn't as good as Huawei mate 10 pro, and Huawei makes honor... If that's what you are referring to.

From what I've heard it detects motion when it focuses and adjusts the shutter speed and iso accordingly to get the best photo. Is this feature in the Mate 10? In my opinion that is a great feature! I assume that works in the Automatic setting. 
Is this feature in the Mate 10 or any other phone? Not sure if it will replace OIS (time will tell), but it's a huge step forward. This phone may not need OIS?? Looking forward to the in-depth AC review.

replies.text: That's pretty neat indeed. Hey if it works better than optical image stabilization then that's even better!

Just checked and the mate 10/10 pro also have this motion detection (AI?) feature. Those cameras also have OIS, so it will be very interesting to look at comparisons. OIS mostly addresses "operator" induced error, or shaky hands on the camera (a definite problem in this household!). A combination of OIS and motion detection might just be pretty darn good.
That would be great indeed. Especially for me because I like to take pictures of my active child.
